positive: So yes, very good slim light laptop overall, 15.3" screen size is perfect too, though I hope these spinning wheel, fan noise, trackpad issues are all software related and get a quick fix from Lenovo.
If you want to play games on it, it also runs pretty well I can play marvel rivels for a little without it being weird.
The screen is great, vibrant and with great blacks, despite being a IPS screen.
negative: From what I've read Dell is not that great and many people hate them, have trouble with them, etc.
All IPS panels have IPS glow, but this one has the worst case of glow I've ever seen.
The keys feel a little shallower than on the HP 14c, but once I got into a groove, I had no complaints.

positive: Good build quality, great screen, great camera, plenty of memory and storage space, speakers sound great.
So yes, very good slim light laptop overall, 15.3" screen size is perfect too, though I hope these spinning wheel, fan noise, trackpad issues are all software related and get a quick fix from Lenovo.
Price ~€871 Thanks in advance; please enlighten me with your superior experience; I’ll gladly follow the community’s judgment.
negative: The keys feel a little shallower than on the HP 14c, but once I got into a groove, I had no complaints.

I’ve always been a sucker for high-capacity drives, so the tiny 512 GB of space made me feel uneasy every single time I thought about my locally stored movies, TV shows, comics, games… Point is: I wanted to upgrade.
